definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings

sentences.english: It is an important part of public prosecution power .
sentences.chinese: 公诉变更是公诉权的一项重要权能。

sentences.english: It is an important part of public prosecution power .
sentences.chinese: 公诉变更是公诉权的一项重要权能。

sentences.english: Mr Grant prosecuted him and watched him put to death.
sentences.chinese: Grant先生对他提起公诉并最终看到他被处死。

sentences.english: Now every country is different in application of public discretion, discretion power of public prosecution of proc.
sentences.chinese: 公诉裁量权是检察机关的一项非常重要的权力。

sentences.english: The ruling was made in November, but it's only now been made public.
sentences.chinese: 这一决定是于去年11月做出，只是现在才公诉于众。

sentences.english: In Great Britain, the Attorney General prosecutes for the Grown in certain cases.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，检察总长在某些案件中代表王室进行公诉。

sentences.english: Prosecutors say Google was too slow to remove the video.
sentences.chinese: 公诉方表示，谷歌没有及时删除这些视频。

sentences.english: His wife and son were also indicted in the sweeping case.
sentences.chinese: 在这宗大案中，其夫人和儿子也被提起了公诉。

sentences.english: Prosecutor accused of criminal facts are clear and sufficient evidence, convicted.
sentences.chinese: 公诉机关指控的犯罪事实清楚，证据充分，罪名成立。

sentences.english: The district attorney prosecuting the case.
sentences.chinese: 对案件提起公诉的地方检察官。

sentences.english: Like decisions not to prosecute, settlements tend to be ill-suited to judicial supervision .
sentences.chinese: 和不提起公诉的决定一样，和解趋于不适宜司法监督。

sentences.english: A prosecutor assigned to the courtroom handled most of the routine appearances and arraignments that were paraded through each day.
sentences.chinese: 一个公诉人一天会被分配到很多例行的开庭和传讯。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused was in the house when the crime was committing.
sentences.chinese: 公诉人公诉方声称，当犯罪发生时，被告在住宅内。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused was in the house when the crime was committing.
sentences.chinese: 公诉人公诉方声称，当犯罪发生时，被告在住宅内。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused be In the house when the crime be commit .
sentences.chinese: 公诉人公诉方声称，当犯罪发生时，被告在住宅内。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused be In the house when the crime be commit .
sentences.chinese: 公诉人公诉方声称，当犯罪发生时，被告在住宅内。

definition: public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)
criminal court/abbr. for 刑事法庭[xing2 shi4 fa3 ting2]
to protest against a verdict/to lodge an appeal
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
